appendix.title: Twinkle SIP Softphone
appendix.para: The Twinkle SIP Softphone (Twinkle) is available for Linux only, and can be downloaded from http://www.twinklephone.com/. Some Linux distributions may offer Twinkle through the distribution's Package Manager application.

section.title: Configuring Twinkle for the Converged Application Demonstration
section.para: In the Converged Application demonstration (the demonstration), Twinkle is used to receive calls initiated by the JAIN SLEE Server (the server). After the customer makes purchases through the Mobicents Seam Furniture Store (the portal), the server calls the customer via a SIP Softphone and asks them to confirm the order and specify a date and time for delivery. In order for Twinkle to receive the calls, specific configuration is required prior to deploying the demonstration on the Mobicents server. To ensure the demonstration functions correctly, follow the setup instructions detailed in this document.

Twinkle is recommended because it supports codecs compatible with the Media resource adapter used in the Converged Application demonstration. Other SIP Softphones may be compatible with the Media-RA server, however configuring softphones other than Twinkle is not covered in this document.

note.para: The screens depicted in this document are taken from Twinkle v1.4.2. The settings in later versions of Twinkle may be similar to those featured in this document, however, configuring later versions of Twinkle is not covered in this document.

step.title: Download
step.para: Download and install Twinkle on the machine that will run the server, and demonstration.

important.para: Twinkle must be installed locally because the Mobicents SIP server is bound to the http://localhost:8080/ address.

step.title: Run
step.para: Start Twinkle by selecting the application from the Applications > Internet menu.

section.para: When Twinkle starts for the first time, it will ask for basic account settings to be configured. Follow the procedure to configure the basic settings required by the demonstration.

step.title: Start the User Profile Wizard
step.para: If this is the first time Twinkle has run on the machine, select the Wizard option in the dialog.
If Twinkle has run previously on the machine, in the main Twinkle window select File > Change User and click Wizard in the Create Profile group.

Select the "customer" user, and click Edit in the Modify Profile group.

section.para: Now that user account settings are defined, Twinkle must have the global SIP port defined. This port is used by Twinkle to communicate to the Registrar server.

step.para: From the Twinkle main screen, select Edit > System Settings.
Click Network and set SIP port: to 5059
Click OK to set the SIP port.

section.para: Twinkle is now configured to work with the demonstration, and can be closed.

note.para: If the server is not running, the Twinkle client will report a Registration Failed error. This is normal if the server is not running, because it is acting as the SIP Registrar for Twinkle. Once the server is started, Twinkle will work correctly with the specified settings.
